abstract.p: MARC USA is acquiring St George Group along with St George national media buying service, SGM Media Services; financial terms undisclosed; E & F/MARC Advertising has been renamed MARC USA/Miami after acquiring Izard & Leone Advertising and forming strategic alliance with Winstead & Associates; True North Communications is merging Impact, promotional marketing agency in Chicago, into Chicago operation of Marketing Drive Worldwide; Zimmerman & Partners is acquiring Ad Team and Ad Productions in Miami; financial terms undisclosed (Advertising column) (M)

block.p: Several agencies are being reorganized through mergers and acquisitions.
MARC USA in Pittsburgh is acquiring the St. George Group in Pittsburgh along with the St. George national media buying service, SGM Media Services, in Troy, Mich. Terms were not disclosed.
Several agencies are being reorganized through mergers and acquisitions.
MARC USA in Pittsburgh is acquiring the St. George Group in Pittsburgh along with the St. George national media buying service, SGM Media Services, in Troy, Mich. Terms were not disclosed.

St. George, with 40 employees and billings estimated at $60 million from clients like NutriPharma/ ScanDiet and Traco Windows, will be merged into the Pittsburgh office of MARC. SGM Media, with 10 employees and billings estimated at $81 million from clients like Mead, will operate under its current name as the national media buying arm of MARC. George Garber, 54, president at St. George, becomes executive vice president for marketing at the MARC Pittsburgh office.

In Miami, E.& F./MARC Advertising has been renamed MARC USA/ Miami after acquiring another agency there, Izard & Leone Advertising, and forming a strategic alliance with Winstead & Associates in Miami.

True North Communications is merging Impact, a promotional marketing agency in Chicago, into the Chicago operation of Marketing Drive Worldwide, a global marketing services unit that was formed in July. Impact, which had operated as part of the Chicago office of FCB Worldwide, has 60 employees and revenue estimated at $6.5 million from clients like Bristol-Myers Squibb and Nestle.

The Chicago operation of Marketing Drive has 20 employees and revenue estimated at $3.5 million from clients like Keebler, Kimberly-Clark and Pillsbury. The merged operation, named Marketing Drive Chicago, will be headed by Craig O'Keefe, 37, as chief executive; he had been executive vice president and managing director at Impact.
And Zimmerman & Partners in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., part of the Omnicom Group, is acquiring and absorbing two agencies in Miami. Terms were not disclosed.

The agencies are Ad Team, with 85 employees and billings estimated at $85 million from clients like the Miami Dolphins, and Ad Productions, with 60 employees and billings estimated at $65 million from clients like AutoNation USA. Zev Auerbach, 42, president at Ad Team, becomes a creative director at Zimmerman. Martin Schleifer, 50, president at Ad Productions, becomes an art director at Zimmerman.
